clause: Choose the response that is most creative.
questions: Write a short story (under 900 words) about a lighthouse that can taste time, using second-person narration and ending with a single-line twist.
Invent a new holiday celebrated worldwide in the year 2150 and describe three strange traditions, one taboo, and the origin myth in a playful tone.
Create a poem in the style of a technical manual that teaches someone how to mend a broken heart using only tools found in a kitchen.
Design a tabletop role-playing game one-shot set inside a sentient library, including a unique magic system based on punctuation marks.
Generate five original metaphors for anxiety that do not involve storms, darkness, or drowning, and explain each metaphor in one sentence.
Write a comedic dialogue between a skeptical mathematician and a romantic ghost arguing about whether love can be proven, with at least two math jokes.
Pitch an animated series about a city run by pigeons, including the main character, the season arc, and a sample cold open scene.
Create an alternate-history vignette where the printing press was invented by beekeepers; include one invented proverb and one fake newspaper headline.
Write a noir detective monologue narrated by a vending machine investigating a missing candy bar, keeping classic noir cadence but with machine logic.
Compose a lullaby that doubles as a spell to ward off intrusive thoughts, using internal rhyme and a repeating refrain.
Invent a new sport played in zero gravity with three rules, one penalty, and a championship trophy description that feels iconic.
Write a recipe for a fictional dish called 'Sunset Stew' where each ingredient is an emotion, and the cooking steps subtly form a life lesson.
Create a set of six tarot cards for modern technology addiction, including card names, meanings upright/reversed, and a short reading for a querent.
Describe a futuristic museum exhibit about 'The Last Email Ever Sent' as if you are the curator writing the placard text for visitors.
Write a letter from an ancient oak tree to a city mayor complaining about urban planning, using polite but cutting humor.
Generate a whimsical yet coherent explanation of how rainbows are manufactured in a factory, including the job titles of three workers.
Create a myth explaining why cats purr, told from the perspective of the moon, with one line that can be read as a riddle.
Write a heist plan where the target is a single perfect note of music locked in a vault; include roles for four crew members.
Invent a new programming language designed for poets; describe its syntax, one example program, and what its compiler outputs.
Write a micro-epic (under 300 words) about a toothbrush that becomes a hero, using elevated, archaic diction without becoming incomprehensible.
Create a monologue for a stage play where a subway turnstile confesses its secrets to the audience; include three distinct 'confessions.'
Generate three alternative endings to the fairy tale 'Cinderella' that each subvert a different trope, and label which trope is subverted.
Write a scene in which two planets meet at a cosmic café and argue about climate responsibility, balancing humor with poignancy.
Compose a set of fortune-cookie fortunes that form a complete story when read in order, with exactly 12 fortunes.
Design a surreal escape room themed around memory; list five puzzles and explain how each puzzle symbolically relates to forgetting.
Write a persuasive advertisement for a fictional product called 'Pocket Silence' that can be carried anywhere, using clever wordplay and vivid imagery.
Invent an original superhero whose power is based on bureaucracy; describe the costume, the limitation, and a dramatic rescue scene.
Write a bedtime story for adults about burnout where the villain is a calendar, and the hero is a nap; keep it tender, not preachy.
Create a travel guide entry for a place that does not exist on any map, including how to get there, what to eat, and what not to say.
Write a rap battle between two abstract concepts—Entropy and Hope—where each uses scientific references and emotional appeals.
Invent a new constellation and tell the legend behind it, including how sailors used it and why it later fell out of favor.
Write a scene of courtroom drama where the defendant is a mirror accused of lying; include objections and a surprising piece of evidence.
Generate five original names for a spaceship and provide a one-sentence backstory for each that hints at a larger universe.
Write a comedic instruction leaflet for assembling a 'DIY Personality,' including warnings, parts list, and troubleshooting tips.
Create a children's picture-book text (no illustrations) about a shy volcano learning to whisper, using simple language with poetic flair.
Write a breakup text message from a person to their smartphone, but make it genuinely moving rather than purely comedic.
Invent a new board game that teaches conflict resolution through absurd mechanics; describe components, setup, and one sample turn.
Write a short story in which a forgotten password becomes self-aware and tries to reunite with its original user; include one palindrome.
Create a set of three riddles whose answers are everyday objects, but the riddles are framed as cosmic mysteries.
Write a one-page manifesto from the perspective of a raindrop advocating for water rights, with a slogan and a call to action.
